Reviews.Title: “Great service but a bit noisy on second night”
Reviews.Author: April D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The front desk service was excellent. The older style room was clean and tidy but the sliding glass door didn't lock. Because we were on the 4th floor, we didn't mention it to the front desk until we checked out. The free breakfast was tasty. Great assortment of breakfast options. The only thing that was a little disturbing was the metal Orkin pest control box that was on the floor beside the pancake maker. Possibly a mouse issue but living on the coast, we are used to that. The second night of our stay the noise outside the hotel was loud. We believe it may have been from the townhouses behind the hotel. All in all service was great, food was good and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Twocarters
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel 3 or 4 times a year for business and pleasure over the last five years. It is easy to travel to downtown Vancouver as the bus stop is at the front door. The Pacific National Exhibition Grounds are across the street. We find the location great as we visit family who are on the bus route and also easily accessible by car from here. The staff have always been friendly and the service good. However, the hotel is beginning to look tired (the room carpets have had a hard life - they are clean, but the room we had last weekend had a small hole in the carpet). The beds are comfortable and the linens spotless. We appreciate the Wi-Fi as an added bonus. The breakfast bar (included in the room rate) is well stocked and the staff there are obliging. The hotel suits us fine.

Reviews.Title: “Business favorite”
Reviews.Author: Maicolgiordan
Reviews.Content: I come to Vancouver 2 or 3 times a year for my business and for the last few years I have been a guest of this hotel because is perfectly located relatively close to most of my customers and because is well priced with quite nice rooms, breakfast included and a gym which is always a nice plus. There is a basement garage free for the guests and service is always good and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, quiet room, and comfortable value.”
Reviews.Author: 34Meeechigan
Reviews.Content: I paid 108 USD each night, which in my case, is slightly cheaper than some of the other IHG hotels I've searched through. I enjoyed the oh-so-kind front desk staff, an easygoing atmosphere, a quickly-cleaned room, and close access to several restaurants. I also discovered an event room which was to my liking as a participant and should I ever give a presentation in Vancouver, I'd consider this place. As a piece of caution, as a US citizen, I should mention that I didn't pay attention to whether my bank cards would be compatible with the necessary machines and card readers, and I used a phone plan that has zero coverage in Canada. Sure, I brought my passport and just enough currency but I could have saved myself some tension had I simply checked out my phone and bank cards before leaving for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: JanOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the junior suite on the non-road side of the hotel. It was comfortable, clean, and although we didn't use the kitchen area, it seemed good although there wasn't much in the way of plates/cutlery etc. There was some noise from the townhouses that backed the back of the hotel, but I'm sure much less than the road-side of the hotel. Breakfast as usual is one of the best offered by hotels when it is included in the price. HI express has a wide range of breakfast items. We would stay here again. It is very close to the PNE.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: william r
Reviews.Content: Check in was a snap, was clean and convenient to everything, hot breakfast served on time.A good deal of choices for breakfast. No problems with my room.Near the fairgrounds and as well a WALMART is nearby for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Minnie0723
Reviews.Content: This was not a pleasure trip to Vancouver, my older brother had passed away and my sister and I were out to bring his remains home to the East Coast. We had rushed to get a flight out and had not made reservations at a hotel before leaving. We were able to walk in and get a room without any problem. We were at the front of the building, but the noise was not unbearable and it was kind of neat to see the traffic and people walking by. Comfortable and close to many little shops, drug store, park and a fabulous Italian bakery. The staff were extremely helpful and when we asked if we could have a frig and microwave brought up to the room, it was delivered within the hour. The onsite laundry was extremely clean and well kept and breakfast in the morning was a great way to start your day off. The Press Box Pub next door was a great spot for a quick bite to eat in the evenings. The staff were helpful in getting us cabs and letting us know of the different options for transit. What we appreciated most was on the day we were coming back we had been informed that the shuttle ran to the airport at 8:00am or 10:00am unfortunately our plane had been delayed so that neither of these times really worked for us. We were pleasantly surprised when the driver informed us that he could take us out at 9:00am instead if that worked for us. This was a great spot to stay and if I get to go back to Vancouver for a vacation I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Northline42
Reviews.Content: Pros: cleaning staff do a great job and are incredibly nice. Front staff are helpful although they can be a little hit-and-miss. Breadfast buffet has a pretty good variety given that nothing is actually produced at the hotel (eggs, bacon, sausages etc are of the microwave variety) -- you can actually eat a fairly balanced and healthy breakfast. Rooms are your typical modern standard room: beds are fine, layout is the same as everywhere (bed, desk, flatscreen tv, etc.). Hotel shuttle service is great, but it starts too late and ends to early to be really counted upon to avoid the $50 cab ride from the airport. Cons: I had major problems with the keys working -- on one evening I had to go 5 times back and forth until the lock finally worked. Also there were a group of German (?) construction workers who loved -- LOVED -- to smoke, and this included their non-smoking rooms whose air circulation system ensured that everyone on the floor also smoked their cigarettes. One night was particularly bad with them smoking, drinking, playing music, long resounding belches. The hotel staff seemed either impotent to do anything about it or it was a business decision to keep these guys happy as they were long term customers. Luckily the construction workers were either fairly stand-offish or actually nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for PNE, though Wi-Fi needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: A colleague of mine and I stayed here, as we were attending a show at the PNE. Location was great, because we were right across the street from the PNE. The property is also not far from food, shopping (like Walmart), etc. The free breakfast buffet was ample and decent. This property also has a shuttle to the hotel, but its schedule is not great... it runs every 2 hours starting at, I believe, 8 am. The staff were great though, try as they may, they could not do anything about the almost non-existent wireless internet for the 2 days I was there. Quality internet is among my top three Must-Haves when I travel. However, the staff did take a couple of bucks off my bill, which was a great gesture for something that was out of their hands. They tell me they have a new system coming in not too far down the road. So despite being extremely aggravated by slow to non-existent internet, I still rate this property quite well for the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the cleanliness of the property, the beds being comfy, a decent breakfast buffet, etc. I will stay here again... though I may call ahead and double-check the Wi-Fi has been improved before I do.

Reviews.Title: “Wondered what I would find”
Reviews.Author: Neil F
Reviews.Content: I drove from Vancouver airport and the sat nav system took me via Vancouver city centre and along West & East Hastings Street. I have travelled the World and seen many sights however I have never seen so many homeless, drug addicts lining the street. I have to be honest I was thinking what have I done booking a hotel on such a street. Thankfully as I got nearer the hotel the area changed and was only slightly dodgy rather than down right dodgy. The hotel didn't look much from the outside but I parked the car in the secure gated car park and took the elevator to reception. The hotel staff were excellent and I was allocated a room at the back of the hotel. The room was large and included a king size bed and settee. However the downside was that it was dark, the weather didn't help, and the lighting in the room was very poor. On the good side once the clouds lifted the view was spectacular looking over the mountains. The room was quiet and the bed comfortable and the internet was free. The free breakfast was a typical North American buffet of cereals, bread and muffins along with tea and coffee. The internet was rather erratic and the hotel had to call the provider to sort it out. The staff were very helpful and the situation was sorted out very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Solid budget choice”
Reviews.Author: ChiHeart
Reviews.Content: It's a holiday inn express and that's exactly what it is. It has a distinct feel of a ramada inn (slightly cheaper hotel) that was renovated 80% of the way. For example, the balconies are forgotten and completely bare. The big plus of this place is it s clean, cheap for Vancouver and they have an amazing free shuttle service that takes you to the big attractions. Oh and breakfast is included. A thumbs up overall. This hotel is out of the way, but vc is a small city so its an easy 10 min drive into the center.

Reviews.Title: “Senior lady traveller”
Reviews.Author: Kiera70
Reviews.Content: As a senior woman travelling alone I would like to say that while I was a guest of HI Express at 2889 East Hastings I felt well looked after. The staff was very attentive to my needs and I felt safe and secure while a guest there. The room I was assigned was clean and comfortable and I was well rested on my awakening each morning. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely being staying there again on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: redomaha
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 4 day stay at this hotel which is deserving of a compliment. 100% of the staff (everyone from the front desk, maids, janitors, maintenance people, security, etc.) at this hotel would stop what they were doing, look you in the eye and happily greet and acknowledge your presence or offer help. After realizing this event we went looking to find the exception anywhere we could and came up with nothing to counter the 100%. This made the stay very enjoyable as the hotel and rooms were very clean, but the need of a renovation was forgotten in the smiles! Thanks, Omaha NE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would defenitly come back”
Reviews.Author: DixieNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in September. This is a very nice hotel. Be sure to ask for a room at the back, away from East Hastings street. Staff is very helpfull. We wanted to extend our stay, it wasn't possible at the moment we asked but later that night we received a phonecall from the frontdesk. There was room for us but we already made a reservation with another hotel. We really appreciated the phonecall. Too bad it isn't possbible to walk to downtown, the distance is just too long and you have to pass a dodgy neighbourhood. On the first night we had dinner in the Pressbox. Food was good and the atmosphere was nice. If we return to Vancouver we would stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience. I would definately go back again when in the area.”
Reviews.Author: mwinquist
Reviews.Content: Recently we had an opportunity to stay at the hotel. Everything was to standard, and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We confirmed with the hotel desk staff that there was a courtesy shuttle to the airport when we arrived. We had to leave at 6 AM to get to the airport in time to catch our flight. The night before, when we were arranging for the shuttle we were informed that it did not leave that early. There was no documentation concerning the shuttle times, and when previously calling the hotel to ask if they definately had an airport shutte, no one ever told me that there were certain hours that the shuttle ran. We asked to speak to a manager, and Mr. David Goguen, the General Manager, met with us. He was very apologetic, and was more than willing to help. He confirmed there was nothing indicating the times the shuttle ran, He went above and beyond his management team, and arranged for "special" complimentary transportation to the airport for us. This type of service is what we always expect from Holiday Inn. On an added note: The hotel is right on a bus line, making it very convenient to hop on the bus to get to town.

Reviews.Title: “Good first or last night on a road trip”
Reviews.Author: MistletoeDerbyUK
Reviews.Content: Good location / value to visit Vancouver with trolley bus into downtown from door. Free car park. Comfortable, quiet room. Not much around to walk to except basic shopping. Breakfast above average.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful find!!”
Reviews.Author: loretta c
Reviews.Content: Hotel was impeccably kept, transportation was right at my door, Hotel was upkept well, free breakfast was delicious and staff was so helpful. Excellent value and location is right down the road from the PNE. Don't think I could have enjoyed a stay more!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Tinadv
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience at a Holiday Inn Express and I think I prefer it to a full service Holiday Inn. We were greated with a pleasant smile and offered assistance at check in. We were informed of the free breakfast and I was thanked for my business after the transaction. The room was clean and very comfortable, I was there for four nights and didn't have any issues with anything, the staff were pleasant and I was even thanked (with a welcome letter) from the manager as I have a priority club member number. I would recommend staying at this hotel and the location was very central. It was excellent for me. .

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: pilar88
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and because I rented a car and the parking is free and secure. The rooms are very comfortable, I enjoyed the breakfast because it included eggs and bacon and not only bread. The thing that I didn't like was the location, let me explain: if you don't have a car and try to walk towards downtown, the first 3 or 4 blocks are fine but the rest is full of homeless people in the sidewalk. Other than that, I enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: alikay61
Reviews.Content: Friendly, comfortable and conveniently located hotel. Breakfast was good and the free secure parking was useful. The location is very convenient both for sightseeing in greater Vancouver, and catching the bus just a minute's walk away for exploring downtown. Clean and comfortable rooms, and efficient, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: lonestargal360
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the night before a cruise to Alaska. The staff, especially Bryan, Richard, and Tyler were very friendly, helpful, and professional. The GM was active and engaging to all guests - we loved the hotel. The shuttle service was a blessing - and the recommendations were spot-on. Location isn't all that great for downtown events, but with the shuttle, you can still get around town. If we ever go to Vancouver again, this is the place we'll stay! Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: SarahChilds
Reviews.Content: A good 'value for money' hotel. Comfortable clean and very friendly. The breakfast was a good filler that lasted the day. Shame we needn't find the gym on the fourth floor until we left!!!! The only problem for some may be the proximity to Downtown/Gastown/Yaletown etc. However, if you are happy to use the (very frequent and easy to use) tram or taxi its fine. Iwould definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but would prefer Downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Squirrel25
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 (two couples and a senior). We had three rooms for two nights. We only booked here as there was no availability in the downtown area due to various events. Whilst it was not our chosen location (purely because we had limited time in Vancouver and would prefer not having to travel in and out of the city area) the staff were friendly and efficient. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a room at the book and had no noise problems what so ever. I'm not sure about our travelling companions who had rooms on East Hastings although they did not mention any noise issues. Shuttle was fully booked for the two days but it is easy to catch the bus into town and relatively quick. The club next door didn't look all that inviting but the staff were terrific and food that we had for lunch was delicious. We walked a number of blocks in the direction of the city and came across a brilliant mexican restaurant that had live music. We got great rates booking directly with the hotel. Agree there is a seamier side to Vancouver - but what city doesn't. We never felt unsafe. Recommended for top rates close to city with convenient transport options.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Amanda”
Reviews.Author: Kathywenger
Reviews.Content: Be sure to stop by the press box restaurant & lounge. amanda is a great asset to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Package”
Reviews.Author: hrw1953
Reviews.Content: While not in the heart of town , the stay provides great value. Clean and large rooms, better than average breakfast , free internet and a shuttle to airport or cruise terminal. Be sure to make reservations in advance for shuttle Some folks may be scared away by address but location is ok. Need to take bus on Hastings to downtown but buses run frequently and you can get excat change from front desk . The bus ride does show the seamier side of Vancouver Would certainly recoomend staying here and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, but loud.”
Reviews.Author: duckie_ducks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for parking, free breakfast and extremely friendly staff. The housekeeping staff were very thorough. But, my room was right on East Hastings and it was very loud, so loud that my 3 year old son and I barely slept the 2 nights we were there. My friend inquired for me about having a different room, but was told that since I paid for my room on-line thru expedia (which was untrue) that I could not change rooms. Then I was told they were full, and they did seem very busy. I did not book through expedia, but through my credit card's travel website to accrue points. I paid the exactly same price as advertised on holidays inn website, no less.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Betty_Hiker
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was good. The only problem was that we were in a room with a skylight which made it hard to sleep with daylight so early this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: PGarcia
Reviews.Content: I just completed a four night stay and I think this hotel is just fine in many respects. Free parking, free breakfast, comfortable quarters, convenient to downtown Vancouver, whether by your own car, taxi or bus. I liked the fact that the stores like Shoppers Drug Mart were right there along Hastings St. Many restaurants and cafes in the area too. My room was in an inner corridor, and not facing Hastings Street, so I had no problems with noise from the outside. I liked the fact that I could open the sliding glass door to get some fresh air. The front desk staff was always helpful too. This is a very good deal. The location is fine. No worries.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds, Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: malocite
Reviews.Content: The room was generally comfortable although slightly on the tired side. The carpets had visible stains and the tube based television had an analogue and fuzzy picture. The wireless internet is free but a little on the slow side. My biggest complaint about this hotel was the paper thin walls. I could hear the neighbours in both sides of the room until late into the night. As a business traveler this made it hard for me to get that good night sleep. I believe after a renovation and a little soundproofing this could be a great hotel.... but until then I'll take a pass the next time I come to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Say no to skylights in rooms with no blinds.”
Reviews.Author: hppytrlz
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel however they put us in a room with a skylight directly over the beds. Sounds nice until 6:30 am when the sun comes glaring in. Not nice when your on vacation. And we knew right away why the check in person was very quick to say that the hotel was full and we could not change rooms. So sad that this could be simply solved by installing a blind made for skylights. Hunter Douglas sells them for about a hundred bucks. Neighborhood is working class no problem but you drive through a sketchy part going into city from here. But if you have a car its convenient and ok for the price. And breakfast was included and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: luvttravel08
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Vancouver before and this hotel I would definitely recommend to anyone. What we liked - Free parking, Free hot breakfast (pancakes, eggs, toast, cereal, coffee/tea/juice etc and pastries) nice big room with a small sitting area and location. What we didnt like - Parking was so small but trust me I feel Vancouver sucks in parking and driving and the walls in the room were very thin. I would definitely come back to stay here if we ever visit Vancouver again. we made a special request to have our room in the back to avoid traffic noises as we have a toddler. they were able to accomdate our request and it was quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated, great for a quick stay everything is at your door step if your trying to expereince the true Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: carmelinab
Reviews.Content: If you book your stay with one of the big online reservation sites, forget about compensation if there is any issues with the room. Over all very happy with the accommodation, they provide free breakfast and internet. The breakfast was one of the best i have had in a hotel in a long time. The room, it left things to be desired. Wish that the holiday inn would invest some more money in this property. The room was cold, the thermostat did not regulate properly, the shower sang to you while showering, and the outlets were not working so could not get my electronics to charge overnight. The hotel was full, so they could not move me they did offer. I give the staff at triple AAA rating just wonderful attempted to compensate but since i booked on travelocity could not do anything about it. They did offer me other solutions for future bookings. i would stay there any time, price on the other hand a little too high for what i got for new years eve. This place is the perfect location for anyone staying from out of town. The bus going downtown is in front of the hotel, you have excellent food places all around you and it very quiet. Its 1 minute off of highway 1 heading any which way, the view is decent and of course your not stuck downtown where your paying for parking. The place is worth the stay, again the staff and location make the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Nice People!”
Reviews.Author: ChristyB44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting some friends and had decided to stay in the city. As we were planning on having a few drinks we thought it best to stay at a hotel. The people at the desk were very nice and helpful. I travel a lot on business and this was one place I thought that others should know. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. We wil stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Traci422
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a recent trip to Vancouver. It’s a great location within walking distance to Pacific Coliseum, the Canucks Outlet store and restaurants. Add the HIE standards of free parking, breakfast and Wi-Fi and you’re set. However we found the front desk to be inattentive. We weren’t told where to find the breakfast, or what times it was open. I had to ask three people where the business center was to find out that it was out of service. Our room was nicely laid out, but not sparkling clean. The hallway carpet was stained so badly my husband commented on the dirt and he normally doesn’t notice that things aren’t clean. All in all our stay was fine, but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean, free parking, near lots of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: EmilCA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is about a 15-20 minute drive from downtown Vancouver, but well worth it, given it's free parking and lower prices. The rooms were clean and had decent accommodations, including a soft bed, and various amenities, including a sewing kit, shower gel, etc. for the bathroom, and stapler, post-it notes, clips, etc for the desk. The underground parking is a bit tight, but hey, it's free. The free breakfast was fairly decent for this chain, and included hot food such as eggs, sausages, and simple cheese omelets. Nothing fancy, but better than Hampton Inns, for example. And yes, the heating units in the room are quite loud, but they did not keep me awake at night, like some other light sleepers have mentioned in previous reviews. The best part about this hotel is its residential/commercial location. Only a few blocks away are many ethnic restaurants and stores, including Mexican, Vietnamese, Italian, Burmese, Chinese, Thai, Polish, Greek, etc. as well as Starbucks, other coffee houses and fast food, drug stores, etc. A nice evening stroll will give you a chance to see an authentic side of Vancouver you will not see in downtown or the touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms - Check | Parking, Food, Quiet, Service, OOOPS”
Reviews.Author: workinggirlcalgary
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the actual room itself, it was clean and housekeeping did a great job. However, it was so loud we couldn't sleep. Not because of traffic, but because of the heating system!!! No parking except for underground which our truck did not fit in. Continental breakfast barely edible, and front desk service was not good. Would only return out of convenience of location, but that is a big if.

Reviews.Title: “just off Granville St. offering clean and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: ricski64
Reviews.Content: stayed twice during july '10 and was pleased both times. It is best to get rooms with higher floor to reduce street noise, though the hotel is not that tall (5 floors, i think), but it does make a difference. Check in was fast and there's covered, underground, secured parking. Rooms were clean, spacious, the biggest disappointment would be the wireless internet, slooooooow, no really sloooooooow even in the common areas like lounge and lobby. Bartender Tim is a wealth of knowledge of the area and can help pass the time. secured room for bicycles on site guest laundry starbucks kiddie-corner overall a very good place to stay for less than expected...will be back

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Aussie471
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night before departing on a cruise and thought that a few miles out of the City wouldn't be too bad, perhaps we would even get a higher quality hotel as a result. Instead we found a hotel whose staff were reasonably pleasant and tried hard but the room was poor (loose toilet seat, dripping tap) and the overall experience disappointing. Perhaps the best illustration was breakfast. We were pleased to see it included but it turned out to be the most basic of cereal and toast with only paper plates and plastic knives and forks available. The orange juice appeared and tasted like someone was instructed to buy 1 litre of juice then dilute with 10 litres of water, All in all, by far the worst of 10 or so hotels we stayed in during our wonderful holiday in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “A worn out bed”
Reviews.Author: fromnwmont
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in our travels usually with great results but i am afraid this location is getting a tad run down the king bed in our room was lumpy and worn out... It is not in the best part of town to access this location from the West you drive right thru all of the less fortunate living on the streets and there are many!! I also found a bug in my cereal and mouse droppings under out table there was some live mouse traps in the breakfast room........ We always try to find the good in everywhere we go but other than the nice staff there is not much more to say here i am afraid.......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....neighborhood is questionable”
Reviews.Author: jbsmes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and so is the immediate neighboorhood that the hotel is in. But just beware of E. Hastings Street between downtown Vancouver and where the hotel is located. When we got to the hotel our room was not ready so we decided to get the all day bus/boat pass and visit the Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain. By the time we were coming back it was around 10pm and we were riding the public bus down Hastings street. Don't do this. If you use one of these passes and you have to get back to this hotel, get off downtown and take a cab. Hastings Street at night (and during the day) is a scary place. Shelters everyone, people standing and sleeping all over. You get the gist. Hotel was great, just use cab service rather than public bus. We ate at the sports bar next door and it was very good. Room were comfortable although the air condition system in the room was pretty noisy. The best part of this hotel was that they offered free pick up from the cruise ship terminal so that was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - One bad room - One bad staff member”
Reviews.Author: rrafay
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is pretty new and this results in a great hotel for the price. Nice, clean rooms with good quality appointments. The hotel is in a random location (which was good for me, because I had business in the Pacific Exhibition across the street). However, the hotel more than makes up for it, with its free shuttle/taxi service. The free breakfast is standard fare, but appreciated. What I didn't like? -Any room facing East Hastings Street is noisy. Mine, in particular because it was on the 2nd floor above 'The Press Box' which is their bar. This is in spite of me telling them I came for business. It was ridiculously noisy on a Friday night. -One staff member in particular I desired to punch in the face. I called them and booked the shuttle mentioned above to pick me up at the airport. They told me it would be there at 9:22PM... I waited in the designated area till 9:55PM... frustrated, I took a taxi and paid the $40. When I arrived at the hotel, no apology, no nothing... 'well, he should have been there, that is why there are phones at the airport' Gee thanks buddy, but I don't have change and I don't have your number, they confirmed something and failed to follow through. A good hotel would apologize, a GREAT hotel would offer to pay the taxi fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: akoundal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and it was a breeze staying there. Staff is very friendly and hotel is clean and nice. We were happy to find that beds were super comfy. Wireless speed is awesome and connecting to hotstop unlike other hotels. This hotel also has free parking.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH THE DISTANCE FROM THE CITY CENTER”
Reviews.Author: alipg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago. Have absolutely no complaints and recommend it thoroughly. It is a little far from the city center, but I believe they have parking if you are driving. If you are not driving, like us, Vancouver has excellent public transportation and you can go back and forth on the bus or the Skytrain in no time, safely and inexpensively. They also have a free shuttle to the airport and downtown, but you need to make a reservation for that. We used it twice and was very convenient. The hotel is not new, but is very well maintained. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Service was good. Nothing more or less than you would expect from a HIE. They have a hot breakfast buffet (cereals -hot and cold-, eggs, waffles, juices), which was more than enough for us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best beds in the country”
Reviews.Author: summertone
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently renovated, and is very nice and clean. Our room was made up each day. Which was throughly appreciated. The beds were simply put, wonderful. Like sleeping on a feather bed. AWESOME!!!! This hotel is a short walk from the sky train, which was so handy. Lots of shops and restaurants in walking distance. Check in to this hotel was a breeze, and as there was a small mistake made on the booking, I had booked queen beds, and was given doubles, it took all of 5 mins, for them to correct this small error. The front desk was friendly and so helpful. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: grammyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at your hotel from Sept.8 for 4 nights. I was visiting my daughter and son-in-law and new twin grand-daughters that live close by. My room was large with a beautiful king size bed, fridge, micrawave and everything else I could want. The huge selection for breakfast was unbeliveable and included. Underground parking included, pick up and drop off at airport included. It was a $7.50 charge for pick up from airport but cheap as compared to a taxi. Everyone was friendly and Carlos the suttle driver was great. I will be making this my home away from home when I come to visit my grand-daughter again and again. Thank you very much, Lorraine Giesbrecht, Edmonton, Alberta

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price; a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: JABAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: Taxi to downtown area will cost about $13-15 (Canadian). The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were very nice and clean, and the price for the room was great!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Hotel in a Shady Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: Brunswick1977
Reviews.Content: For an inexpensive hotel stay, this is the place. During the day, this location isn't bad at all. At night, it can appear shady. Not because there is an adults only store across the street. The neighborhood doesn't seem like one of those places you want to take a stroll around block in. Unlike most Holiday Inn Expresses (HIE), this is not a standalone building. There are storefronts next to or below the rooms and the building looks like it was converted into a HIE. The room rate includes secured indoor parking underground. The lobby is liberally updated with marble tiles and the included breakfast had a decent selection. Don't get tempted to try the "omelets" -- they're gross. The deadbolt on the door between rooms was broken and the staff immediately resolved the problem by transferring us to another room. The rooms are decent, but not like any other HIE we recall. They had all the amenities of a HIE, but the rooms were outdated. Overall, the staff was friendly and prompt to resolve issues, parking is included, close enough to downtown, decent breakfast spread and outdated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Pacific Coliseum”
Reviews.Author: MisterWombat
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be much better than anticipated from prior TripAdvisor reviews. The location is right across the street from the Pacific National Exposition park and two blocks from the Coliseum, perfect if you're going there. Hastings Street is not scenic but we saw no sign of any questionable characters there as opposed to our visit to the Hyatt downtown where we were accosted by panhandlers and a person was stabbed in the doorway of the Hyatt while we were visiting friends there. Chinese restaurant across the street was quite good, lot of food for the price and a few other restaurants also nearby, plus Italian bakery across street and Burger King beside hotel. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel, but it is a 30-45 minute trip downtown, same time to the airport but hotel picked us up and took us back to airport for free. Also gave us ride downtown and back for free. Many other people said they got free shuttle from hotel when they asked. Our room was clean and comfortable, nice TV with many channels, free wireless internet, big comfortable beds, lots of pillows, plenty of towels, nice hot shower, and all kinds of free shampoos and lotions. You can get a free mini-fridge in your room but they only have a limited number and they were all gone when we arrived. Free breakfast was extensive and included usual baked goods, fruit, yogurt, juices, cereal, etc. plus four hot items - scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage patties, and cheese omelets. Menu said there would be two each day but there were all four hot items every day we were there for a week. Room seats about 50 but whenever hotel was full, staff added tables in an adjoining area and we never had any trouble getting a seat. Hotel staff was very helpful whenever we made any request, let us print airline boarding passes in their office, gave directions when needed, booked taxis quickly, etc. Better service than I've had in a lot of 5-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jagoodbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to our cruise. We arrived on 9/20/08 on Amtrak from Seattle. The hotel offers free shuttle from the Amtrak Station and also from the hotel to the cruise ship terminal. When we arrived at the Amtrak station, I called the hotel and they said they would be about 15 minutes late. I called again 30 minutes later and they said they would not be able to pick us up, but if we took a cab, they would pay for it. Upon our arrival, we paid the cab and gave the receipt to the hotel and they paid right up. The hotel is located next to a park which was nice to walk through. It is also quite a distance from most attractions in Vancouver, but there is a bus stop located right in front of the hotel. We used the bus and it turned out great. On the morning of our cruise, we checked out and the shuttle was right on time to take us to the cruise ship terminal. Nice comfortable bed and a good free breakfast. Also, nice friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Italtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 10/15 minutes from downtown in a strategic position to reach in short time all the main Vancouver's attractions. The location is a not the best of the town but the hotel and the garage are safe (the garage is gated) so using the car is the best choice. In the day time it's comfortable to reach downtown by bus (the stop is in front of the hotel) or driving (following the Hastings St you arrive in downtown in minutes). The Hotel is clean and the complementary breakfast makes a difference. For sure I'll go back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: mymsman
Reviews.Content: A good hotel but while the immediate area around the hotel is OK it is a long way from downtown and it is a slow journey through a very run down neighbourhood. We primarily chose it because we could stay for free using Priority Club Points Break reward nights so we got good value for money! If I was using real money I would prefer to be in a better area. As many have noted the breakfast are is small. We ate dinner at Tom & Jerry across the road which offers 10% discount - OK but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Chris Duc
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and we were not impressed. It seems like an older hotel that needs some work. There were brown water stains on the ceiling in the bathroom and the grout around the tub could have used some bleach. The microwave had a piece cut out of the interior of the door and burnt our popcorn. There was a stain on the seat of the chair in the bedroom. The "suite" was two rooms and the only TV was on a bureau in the living room so if you wanted to watch it from the bed you would have been about 20 feet away! The bed and pillows were comfortable but it certainly wasn't worth the money we paid. The place needs an overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but in poor location.”
Reviews.Author: Seadog68
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but in a poor location. We had a room at the back of the hotel so didn't suffer traffic noise. Room and facilities were excellent although, as others have pointed out, the breakfast room is far too small. Room was big, well-furnished and the housekeeping was good. The front desk staff were mainly very helpful. Beware the misleading statement on the hotel website about its proximity to the skytrain. It is in fact a 15 minutes bus ride away. The hotel is well served by Vancouver's trolley buses and the front desk will help you with directions, but the skytrain is of no use if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfllmg
Reviews.Content: They gave us an upgraded room in one of the higher floors and it was nice, clean and big. The hallways look like they need some renovation, though. The continental breakfast that was included was just OK, not many options but the worst part was that the seating area is very limited. Many people couldn’t find a place to sit and just left without having breakfast. In general the hotel is good for the price, everything else in Vancouver is just too expensive. The area where the hotel is located at it’s not so nice. I had to go out to a drugstore at night and I saw a lot of homeless people on the street.

Reviews.Title: “If You Don't Expect Much You Won't Be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Traveller03337
Reviews.Content: Had read reviews on TripAdvisor but was hoping for better! Fortunately we didn't spend much time there. Issues for us:- 1. The room we had was scruffy with stained carpets and furnishings and threadbare towels. 2. The room overlooked the main road downtown into Vancouver and the traffic noise kept us awake all night. 3. The wireless internet connection only worked well in the bathroom! 4. No fridge in the room. 5. A breakfast of sorts was provided but the scrambled eggs were awful and tasted as though they had been made with powder!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Adios_Hiexpress
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay at a hotel I ever had. To start with, we had reserved a room with at least two full beds. All we got was a room with one full bed. The room was extremely noisy because of the traffic noise. When we complained, they gave us two pairs of cotton balls to stick in our ears. Finally, at 11:00 pm, we dragged the mattress to the bathroom and put it on the floor between the tub and the toilet. I had almost 200 miles of driving ahead of me the following day and I needed the sleep. I have pictures to show the sleeping arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location 'iffy'”
Reviews.Author: twasbrillig4
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel and whilst the immediate area around the hotel is ok, not too far away (maybe around a mile) is a homeless problem the like I have never seen before in any major city in the west. We drove through it on a few occasions on our way to see the sights and the scale of it was disturbing. This is the only reason I would not recommend this hotel to a friend - it is not the best introduction to a beautiful city, nor a great memory. Our room was on the 4th floor with a good view of the mountains beyond. The king bed was excellent and the curtains and bedding were attractive. There was a desk and a sofa plus a coffee machine. The breakfast was typical of Holiday Inn Express with all the usual items of bagels, muffins, toast, fruit etc. It was served from 6.30 am and there were a few of us waiting to go in to the dining area at that time, I assume, mostly because of the time difference experienced by many of the guests. A couple from the east coast of Canada in their eighties were having a 3 day stay here before embarking on an Alaskan cruise. I was full of admiration for anyone staying here without own transport but especially so at their age - although they did seem very active and had their transport arrangements sorted out. The car parking arrangement suited us well, with your room key needed to enter the car park and again in the elevator to take you to any floor other than the lobby. The elevator was accessed from the underground parking area which was ideal. We did lunch one day at Tom and Jerry's across the road, which was just okay but didn't nourish the soul! If you have a satnav or a good map, I could recommend a pretty tree-lined small town in well-heeled west Vancouver called Dundarave and a restaurant called Dundarave Fish Market. The town also had a couple of coffee shops and other places to eat which I should have liked to have tried. The sunset views over Vancouver from nearby Cypress Mount were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but have a car.”
Reviews.Author: LSC06
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel prior to leaving for a cruise. Our travel agent recommended it because the price was more reasonable than many downtown hotels and we, along with another couple, would have a car. We drove in from Seattle and had no trouble locating the hotel. Service at the front desk was excellent, and the free underground parking was fine. (I saw some earlier reviews complaining about the parking, but we had a fairly large car, and no trouble parking.) We liked the security and keyed elevator. The hotel lobby was attractive and our room was perfectly adequate. The bathroom products were quite nice. The morning breakfast provided as part of the cost of the room was also good. However, as earlier writers have indicated, you want to have a car to stay here. We traveled to Vancouver's lovely downtown and harbor twice, and took different routes to and from this area. In all cases we traveled through skidrow sections in what I believe are labeled Japantown and Chinatown. What they look like should be called "junkytown." Vancouver really needs to clean up this mess. I consider this the city's problem, not the hotel's. The hotel offered good accomodations for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat rundown hotel; reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: redeemed holiday inn priority club points for free stay pros: reasonably close to downtown; nice view of mountain and waterfront for rear rooms; front rooms look out to street; free parking garage; good water pressure in shower; reasonable free breakfast; gave me free upgrade to executive suite cons: old, somewhat rundown hotel; worn carpets, furniture, etc.; mold in caulking of bathroom tiles [these people never heard of bleach ??]; area doesn't seem very safe in night; underground parking garage is small & difficult to manouver

Reviews.Title: “Do you like cold showers???”
Reviews.Author: Tom-in-Littleton
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and BOTH mornings we took COLD (really) showers. When we called the front desk to find out what the problem was, the answer was "We have a full hotel and all the guests are fighting over the hot water. I suggest you wait about an hour." The response did not indicate that this was unusual or surprising. True, the place was packed with a tour group, but there is no excuse for a hotel to have NO hot water in the morning. Yes, the neighborhood is not too good - a 24 hr. XXX shop is directly across the street. And, yes, there wasn't near enough hotel staff to keep the tables anywhere near clean at the reasonable good morning breakfast. And, yes, when I asked for the manager to complain/ask for a room refund for the lack of hot water, the response was "You'll have to wait till he comes in about noon, I can't do anything." After providing my email, still no response three weeks later. THIS PLACE SHOULD NOT BE CONFUSED WITH A REAL HOLIDAY INN.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just ok location was HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: twowits
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to canada and probably our last!!!!!!!!!. I had gone through Hello Bc to book my accomodations. I Explained that this was out first trip to Canada and that we wanted a central location for hotel accomodations. We were horrified when we drove done the street and later found out that this holiday inn was on skid row. It was disgusting. Everytime you left you had to drive right through skid row. We were on motorcycles so we had a birds eye view of all the undesirable activites that went on 24 hours a day. We saw a fight a dead body laying on the street drug exchanges going on as well as lots of noise and activity after midnight. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were dated. The fourth floor was the only place to do laundry or to get ice!!!!!!!! The elevator system is insane you have to swipe your card to get up or down. There was no swimmimg pool and the underground parking was a hassle. The one bright spot was the wonderful Italian bakery across the stree. Great people working there. I grew real suspisious of the area when I noticed everyone had bars on their doors and windows. The highlight was when we got lost one day and came down Commercial St and bypassed most of skid row. To bad we didnt get lost the first day. Overall our experience with the hotel wasnt bad but the location is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fine, Location Iffy”
Reviews.Author: lisarose
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located in the northwestern corner of the city, was clean, comfortable, and relatively inexpensive. The breakfast was free and quite good, and we didn't have any problems with the staff or service. The only bad thing about the hotel was it's location. Although it was not in a very bad neighborhood, it was near the seediest part of town. If you stay here, I would strongly recommend having your own car so that you are not limited to the surrounding neighborhood. There is a busline nearby, but I am not sure I would want to ride it at night through the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Curlisue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this HI Express in late May 07 as a party of four and booked a double room. Located approximately 10 min drive out of Vancouver city this is your standard HI Express which offers breakfast and a shuttle service to drive guests into/out of the city. The hotel was clean, staff were attentive and friendly. Breakfast offered was very good and replenished when required. Parking available under the hotel which is included in the cost. - a bonus. The room was a comfortable size for four people, the beds were firm and not flimsy with the linen clean. The bathroom was your standard size and also very clean. The HI express is reasonably priced for accomodation in a city which can occassionally have quite expensive lodgings. If you don't have your own transport, there is a bus stop right out of the front of the hotel. We didn't use public transport but from observation the buses seem to run quite frequently.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, caring”
Reviews.Author: Blanche42
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in Sept. 2006, Our room was very clean and well appointed. The bed was especially comfortable. The linens were up-scale. The breakfast room was like a small restaurant. The man on the front desk at check-in was helpful and friendly. He suggested where to go for dinner and how to get to Stanley Park. There is a complimentry shuttle to the downtown core but we found we could drive it in just a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Inn Express!”
Reviews.Author: travelguy80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Vancouver for three nights back in August 2005. This 3.5 star hotel has a lot of ambiance and has a very quaint, peaceful quality to it. It has the feeling of a small & quiet inn, despite being located in the city. The decor is very tastefully done and even has an upscale feel to it. The beds, comforters, and linens were among the best I've seen in any hotel - very soft, thick, and comfortable. The lobby also has an upscale appearance. Apparantely, the recent renovation has been good for this hotel. The atrium is also a beautiful part of the hotel. The breakfast was also very good. It offered a wide variety of items, such as coffee, tea, milk, juices, hard-boiled eggs, breads, toast, danishes, cereals, and muffins. However, the best part of the breakfast that I enjoyed the most were the cinammon rolls! Very tasty! It was also nice to have free local calls, free parking, free daily morning newspaper, and did I mention the free continental breakfast? I also felt very safe, considering that you had to swipe your room key in order for the elevator to run and to get into the parking garage. My only complaints would be the fact that the hotel is a bit dated. This is very apparent in the parking garage and in some cases, the room. The room I was in also had a hole in the wall where an electrical outlet was supposed to be. Also, be careful not to get a room facing Hastings Street as the noise of the traffic can keep light sleepers awake. I also wanted to mention that this hotel is a bit farther out from downtown Vancouver, so a car is necessary, but I found the cost savings to be worth the extra trouble. Despite that, the location is convenient to the PNE and the Asian restaurant across the street is very good. Overall, great hotel at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad choice for us”
Reviews.Author: mrsanderson
Reviews.Content: While the Holiday Inn Express was a lovely hotel with the most beautiful room I've seen at a Holiday Inn, it didn't work out as well with us. The staff was wonderful and very accomadating when possible however we just never seemed to time the free shuttle right. We arrived by cruise ship but the shuttle was at the airport so we paid the $15 taxi. The next day the shuttle was booked already so we took city buses to downtown and Stanley Park. The following morning we had an early flight out and the shuttle driver started work too late so we paid the $35 taxi fare. While I don't expect things for free we booked this hotel knowing that although it was farther from the places we wanted to go.....the price was reduced and the shuttle was free. At the end of the day, when we added up our transportation expenses, we probably spent the same as what a hotel walking distance to downtown and Robson street would have cost us. BUT.....this was not necessarily the hotels fault.....just bad luck in trying to book the free shuttle. AND....this is a beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express good experience”
Reviews.Author: puppy21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Most accomodating staff. The shuttle service is such a pleasure. Just remember to book it. We never went anywhere that wasn't free with them.Prompt and courteous drivers. Beautiful lobby and the rooms were delightful. H I E has the best beds and bedding. You need your room key for the elevator, why doesn't every hotel put in this addd security feature? A well kept secret, one that should be shared, is the wonderful Italian restaurant right next door. It is though not in downtown. Easy walking distance to the space needle and museums. Who cares there is that shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: KimmyWinnipeg_Canada
Reviews.Content: My family recently spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Express on East Hasting in Vancouver. We were immediately impressed with the lobby interior and the rooms. The free breakfast was extensive and the serving room was nice and large with a tv. The rooms were a good size and nicely appointed as was the bathroom. The staff was excellent. The hotel is situated about 10 minutes (by car) from downtown in a middle class neighbourhood. There are good restaurants across the street. The shuttle pick-up from the airport was great and we used the free shuttle to downtown daily. The driver was very personable. We would definatley stay at this hotel again and will check out the Holiday Inn Express first on any further out-of-town stays.

Reviews.Title: “horrible bill but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my family during august, so they gave us our rooms, so i saw the sheets on the bed weren't changed from the last guest. I called room service they came to change it and dumped the sheets (clean) on the floor. i was shocked and very grossed out. then afterwards when i got the bill they charged me too many times because i cancelled one room and they stilled charged me. the accoutants there stink!

Reviews.Title: “Above-standard HIE, easy busride from downtown”
Reviews.Author: thomasmolloy
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers note that this hotel is quite out of the centre - it's a fifteen minute bus ride (take the 10 or 16) into the centre of Vancouver ($2.25 CAD), which seems fine given the excellent rates and free parking. The hotel's rooms are above-spec for Holiday Inn Express - presumably because the place used to be the Atrium Inn, and was relatively recently converted to the HIE format. Beds are comfy, linens etc are of excellent quality. In short, a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend At The PNE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I made a visit to the PNE and spent 1 night in this hotel. We choose the Holiday Inn on Hastings as it was the closest hotel to the PNE. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself had all the ammenitites of your usual Holiday Inn. It was very handy to be so close to the PNE fair grounds and not have to worry about parking. Our room was clean and well-equipped. However, it did show signs of age (e.g. stains on the carpet and loose door handles). For being on a busy street our room was not too noisy. If you are planning a visit to the PNE, this Holiday Inn is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled with our stay at the Holiday Inn Express this past week. I took my children for a quick three day trip to Vancouver to Playland and chose this hotel because of its proximity to exhibition park. We were slightly concerned because of it's location on Hastings street, as we know Vancouver well, but we had no problems at all. The underground parking was very handy and the breakfast provided every morning had something for all my picky eaters. As we travelled to different destinations around the city it was handy to have a hotel in such a central location. It was a very quick and direct trip to Stanley Park for example. The front desk staff was great and very friendly and the hotel was beautifully clean. The only problem we had was when we tried to access the in room movies and the system was down. This was NOT the fault of the hotel but they did their best to fix the problem and took no time in contacting us once the problem had been fixed so that the kids could see their movie. We would surely stay at this location again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and Good Value if You Have a Car”
Reviews.Author: No_Fixed_Address
Reviews.Content: We just completed a stay here. Two infant grandchildren and their parents stayed on another floor. We all know Vancouver quite well and were pleasantly surprised to find this place. It is within walking distance of the old Pacific National Exhibition site and its Playland and up to a 10-15 minute drive to downtown. The staff throughout were pleasant and professional. We found the rooms modern and clean. We had brought our laptop and were pleased to discover complimentary in-room high-speed wireless. The parking is free, and in a well-lit basement garage that you have to swipe with your room card to open. The complimentary continental breakfast buffet was well above average. Don't stay here for the location (unless you want to be in Vancouver's East End for a specific reason), but it's not a bad drive into downtown and for an all-included total price of less than $100 Canadian we really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: themusicman
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time in this splendid hotel during our stay in Vancouver this summer. I was horrified to read some of the reviews when I returned from holiday and wanted to right the wrongs which I felt were portrayed in the bad reviews. I was delighted to see, however, that other people shared our excellent impression of this hotel. Very friendly staff, clean large rooms and wonderful choice at breakfast time. Would certainly return if we go back to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Helenbrooks
Reviews.Content: Completly remodeled inside, this hotel deserves an updated review as we just had a very positive stay at the beginning of this month. What it lacks in curb appeal is more than made up for on the interior. From the lobby and guest parlor to the rooms, this hotel is tastefully done. The choice of furnishings, comforters and draperies give the standard size room an upscale appearance. New mattress, pillows, thermostat controlled central heat and air ,iron, coffee maker etc. make this hotel above average for a moderate priced chain. Hastings may be a busy main street, but our room was on the backside of the hotel and noise was not an issue. When checking in I unknowingly left my credit card at the front desk and by the time I got to my room it had already been delivered. The complimentary breakfast was a fresh array of foods to satisfy anyone. The age of the hotel does show in the secured underground parking, but it is well lighted and I was happy not paying extra to park. This hotel was absolutely a pleasant surprise, but it is located in an older neighborhood away from the airport and downtown attractions and I recommend it only if you have your own transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after a flight rescheduling in Vancouver. Let me tell you, this place is total crap. First off, it is not in the best part of town at all (the bad end of hastings street) and the parking garage is not well lit and has no security whatsoever. When we arrived at the front desk, they gave us our room and that part went relatively ok. However, when we got to our room, we found it had not been cleaned from the last guest! The bed was unmade and there were used champagne glasses and part favors (it was new years) on the dresser. We went back down and complained and asked for a new room. The front desk attendant's only response was "oh." and she gave us a new room. No apology or anything! We got up to our new room and found that it reeked of smoke even though they claimed it was non-smoking, and was very run-down looking. After considering very seriously demanding a full refund and going to another hotel, we decided since our plane left in only 5 or 6 hours anyways, we might as well get some rest. We slept on a hard bed in a room that looked like it might have been taken off the set of 'Psycho'. We left very early the next morning. Dont go here. There are plenty other hotels for roughly the same price. I recommend the Holiday Inn Metrotown if you are looking for something in the burnaby/vancouver area.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 2889 East Hastings Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V5K 2A1, Canada
